def.dt: :to describe the character or special qualities of (someone or something) How would you characterize the situation/problem? I would characterize this as a positive change for our company. She had difficulty characterizing their relationship. His personality is hard to characterize. The newspaper article characterizes [=portrays] the people of the town as poor and uneducated.

:to be a typical feature or quality of (someone or something) Humor and intelligence characterize [=mark, distinguish] his writing. Farms and large flat fields characterize most of the area. the beliefs that characterized Europe in the 15th century often used as (be) characterized The disease is characterized by a rise in blood pressure.
